thread.title: Local roundup: ECSU men's soccer stays unbeaten at home
thread.title_full: Local roundup: ECSU men's soccer stays unbeaten at home

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: ECSU men's soccer stays unbeaten at home
text: Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 9:12 PM By The Bulletin Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 9:12 PM » RELATED CONTENT WILLIMANTIC — Freshman Ryan Murphy made two saves to earn his sixth shutout and Eastern Connecticut State University stayed unbeaten at home on Sunday with a 2-0 win over Keene State in a Little East Conference men’s soccer game. JD Stearns and Xavier Doran each scored a second-half goal for Eastern (9-1-1, 2-0-1). WOMEN UConn 8 Yale 0 NEW HAVEN — Charlotte Veitner scored four times and the top-ranked Huskies stayed unbeaten and extended their winning streak to 25 games. Casey Umstead had a goal and an assist and Nina Klein made a pair of saves for UConn (11-0). VOLLEYBALL Memphis 3 UConn 1 STORRS — Jade Strawberry had 14 kills and a career-high 27 digs but the Huskies fell in four sets, 25-23, 25-18, 23-25, 25-17). Kenya Cason had 11 kills and 10 digs and Rebecca Rivera handed out 29 assists for the Huskies (7-8, 1-3 The American). FROM SATURDAY Kingswood-Oxford 30 St. Thomas More 12 WEST HARTFORD — A week after their first win since 2012, the Chancellors took an early lead but the Wyverns scored the final 22 points of the game for the win. Former Ledyard standout Leo Clinton scored on a two-yard touchdown run and Juwon Grant caught a 34-yard touchdown from Rob Madison for St. Thomas More (1-1). CROSS-COUNTRY Pomfret 6th at invite CHESHIRE — Sofie Melian-Morse was one of two Pomfret runners in the top 20 at the O’Connell Invitational at Cheshire Academy. Melian-Morse was 11th (22:44) and Kylie Blake finished 20th (23:30) for the Griffins. Mary Madaus led Williams with a 24th-place finish as the Blues were eighth among the 19 teams. On the boys side, Williams’ Will Jarrett finished seventh overall (18:50) and the Blues were ninth. By The Bulletin
